result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy Michaelloyd Buffington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Troy Michaelloyd Buffington is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Troy Michaelloyd Buffington was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham February 22, 2016 - amend to add jail time.

Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation by December 11, 2015 by 11:00 a.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF542.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF542.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to seek and maintain employment.
-Defendant to obtain GED.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants Huber for seek work.

records.addlTxt: Partial SDC pymt rec'd in the amt of $203.30. jaf
State Debt Collection - Notice of Intent returned from post office, return to sender.  Attempted not known/unable to forward. gme

DE appeared today stating he can't make his pymt for 3-15-19.  DE was advised that his Pymt Plan Agmt states the 1st of the mo although the Judge advised in court to start 3-15-19 & that it would have been gone over w/him in person.  DE was also advised that sometimes we change dates from what is stated in court if it suits a DE's pymt schedule better.  DE was asked if he wanted his pymt due date changed, but the DE changed his mind & stated he would like to keep it at the 1st as he is pd weekly.  DE is approved to make a $25 pymt today, the remaining $25 on 3-22-19, & reminded to make his $50 pymt for April on 3-29-19. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Troy Michaelloyd Buffington appeared. Case called at 4:24. Includes 14CF469 and 15CF452. 14CF469 is Branch 4 file and has been administratively transferred to Branch 3.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 3 and 5 in 14CF469 and Ct. 1 in 15CF452 amending to misdemeanor bail jumping. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 and 5  in 14CF469 and guilty of Ct 1 in amending to a misdemeanor bail jumping in 15CF452 . On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 2 and 4 in 14CF469 and Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF452. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
In 14CF469 Ct. 5
- 10 days St. Croix County Jail
   to be served on 2 consecutive weekends commencing not later than Feb. 5 by 6:00pm
- 9 mo DL revocation
- AODA and drivers safety plan 
- $761.50   
- $52 for blood draw 
   Bond to be forfeited. Court sets $50 a month payment plan to begin in March. 

In 15CF452 and  14CF469 Ct. 3  Sentence W/H 
18 months probation with conditions:
- AODA assessment and treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all timesThis prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing
- DE to seek and maintain employment.
- DE to obtain GED.
- Costs to be paid through DOC
-  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.


Atty's to figure out credit. 
DE to meet with the payment clerk. 
Court orders DE to go to the jail today to give a start date. 
DE to report to probation by 12-11-2015 at 11:00pm.
Amended. km
Return on warrant at 12-09-2015 04:00 pm
